docblock.description: RouterOS API client implementation.
docblock.long-description:
This package allows you to read and write information from a RouterOS host using MikroTik's RouterOS API.

PHP version 5

docblock.description: Loads a specified class.
docblock.long-description: Loads a specified class from the namespace.

docblock.description: RouterOS API client implementation.
docblock.long-description:
This package allows you to read and write information from a RouterOS host using MikroTik's RouterOS API.

PHP version 5

docblock.description: A RouterOS client.
docblock.long-description: Provides functionality for easily communicating with a RouterOS host.

docblock.description: Used in {@link isRequestActive()} to limit search only to requests that have a callback.
Used in {@link isRequestActive()} to limit search only to requests that use the buffer.
Used in {@link isRequestActive()} to indicate no limit in search.

tag.name: var
tag.description: The number of currently pending requests.

tag.name: var
tag.description: An array of responses that have not yet been extracted or passed to a callback. Key is the tag of the request, and the value is an array of associated responses.

tag.name: var
tag.description: An array of callbacks to be executed as responses come. Key is the tag of the request, and the value is the callback for it.

docblock.description: Opens a new instance of a RouterOS API client.
docblock.long-description: Opens a new instance of a RouterOS API client with the specified settings.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Hostname (IP or domain) of the RouterOS server.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The port on which the RouterOS server provides the API service.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Whether or not the connection should be a persistent one.

docblock.description: Login to a RouterOS connection.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The communicator to attempt to login to.

tag.name: return
tag.description: TRUE on success, FALSE on failure.

docblock.description: Sets the charset(s) for this connection.
docblock.long-description: Sets the charset(s) for this connection. The specified charset(s) will be used for all future requests and responses. When sending, {@link Communicator::CHARSET_LOCAL} is converted to {@link Communicator::HARSET_REMOTE}, and when receiving, {@link Communicator::CHARSET_REMOTE} is converted to {@link Communicator::CHARSET_LOCAL}. Setting NULL to either charset will disable charset convertion, and data will be both sent and received "as is".

tag.name: param
tag.description: The charset to set. If $charsetType is {@link Communicator::CHARSET_ALL}, you can supply either a string to use for all charsets, or an array with the charset types as keys, and the charsets as values.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Which charset to set. Valid values are the Communicator::CHARSET_* constants. Any other value is treated as {@link Communicator::CHARSET_ALL}.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The old charset. If $charsetType is {@link Communicator::CHARSET_ALL}, the old values will be returned as an array with the types as keys, and charsets as values.

docblock.description: Gets the charset(s) for this connection.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Which charset to get. Valid values are the Communicator::CHARSET_* constants. Any other value is treated as {@link Communicator::CHARSET_ALL}.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The current charset. If $charsetType is {@link Communicator::CHARSET_ALL}, the current values will be returned as an array with the types as keys, and charsets as values.

docblock.description: Sends a request and waits for responses.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Optional. A function that is to be executed when new responses for this request are available. The callback takes two parameters. The {@link Response} object as the first, and the {@link Client} object as the second one. If the function returns TRUE, the request is canceled. Note that the callback may be executed one last time after that with a response that notifies about the canceling.

docblock.description: Checks if a request is active.
docblock.long-description: Checks if a request is active. A request is considered active if it's a pending request and/or has responses that are not yet extracted.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The tag of the request to look for.

tag.name: param
tag.description: One of the FILTER_* consntants. Limits the search to the specified places.

tag.name: return
tag.description: TRUE if the request is active, FALSE otherwise.

docblock.description: Sends a request and gets the full response.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The received responses as a collection.

docblock.description: Completes a specified request.
docblock.long-description: Starts an event loop for the RouterOS callbacks and finishes when a specified request is completed.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The tag of the request to complete. Setting NULL completes all requests.

tag.name: return
tag.description: A collection of {@link Response} objects that haven't been passed to a callback function or previously extracted with {@link extractNewResponses()}. Returns an empty collection when $tag is set to NULL (responses can still be extracted).

docblock.description: Extracts responses for a request.
docblock.long-description: Gets all new responses for a request that haven't been passed to a callback and clears the buffer from them.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The tag of the request to extract new responses for. Specifying NULL with extract new responses for all requests.

tag.name: return
tag.description: A collection of {@link Response} objects for the specified request.

docblock.description: Starts an event loop for the RouterOS callbacks.
docblock.long-description: Starts an event loop for the RouterOS callbacks and finishes when there are no more pending requests or when a specified timeout has passed (whichever comes first).

tag.name: param
tag.description: Timeout for the loop. If 0, there is no time limit.

tag.name: return
tag.description: TRUE when there are any more pending requests, FALSE otherwise.

docblock.description: Gets the number of pending requests.
Cancels a request.
docblock.long-description: Cancels an active request. Using this function in favor of a plain call to the "/cancel" command is highly reccomended, as it also updates the counter of pending requests properly. Note that canceling a request also removes any responses for it that were not previously extracted with {@link extractNewResponses()}.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Tag of the request to cancel. Setting NULL will cancel all requests.

docblock.description: Sets response streaming setting.
docblock.long-description: Sets whether future responses are streamed. If responses are streamed, the argument values are returned as streams instead of strings. This is particularly useful if you expect a response that may contain one or more very large words.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The previous value of the setting.

docblock.description: Gets response streaming setting.
docblock.long-description: Gets whether future responses are streamed.

docblock.description: Closes the opened connection, even if it is a persistent one.
docblock.long-description: Closes the opened connection, even if it is a persistent one. Note that {@link extractNewResponses()} can still be used to extract responses collected prior to the closing.

tag.name: return
tag.description: TRUE on success, FALSE on failure.

docblock.description: Sends a request to RouterOS.
Dispatches the next response in queue.
docblock.long-description: Dispatches the next response in queue, i.e. it executes the associated callback if there is one, or places the response in the response buffer.

docblock.description: RouterOS API client implementation.
docblock.long-description:
This package allows you to read and write information from a RouterOS host using MikroTik's RouterOS API.

PHP version 5

docblock.description: A RouterOS communicator.
docblock.long-description: Implementation of the RouterOS API protocol. Unlike the other classes in this package, this class doesn't provide any conviniences beyond the low level implementation details (automatic word length encoding/decoding, charset translation and data integrity), and because of that, its direct usage is strongly discouraged.

docblock.description: Used when getting/setting all (default) charsets.
Used when getting/setting the (default) remote charset.
docblock.long-description: The remote charset is the charset in which RouterOS stores its data. If you want to keep compatibility with your Winbox, this charset should match the default charset from your Windows' regional settings.

docblock.description: Used when getting/setting the (default) local charset.
docblock.long-description: The local charset is the charset in which the data from RouterOS will be returned as. This charset should match the charset of the place the data will eventually be written to.

tag.name: var
tag.description: An array with the default charset types as keys, and the default charsets as values.

tag.name: var
tag.description: An array with the current charset types as keys, and the current charsets as values.

docblock.description: Creates a new connection with the specified options.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Hostname (IP or domain) of the RouterOS server.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The port on which the RouterOS server provides the API service.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Whether or not the connection should be a persistent one.

tag.name: param
tag.description: A string that uniquely identifies the connection.

docblock.description: Uses iconv to convert a stream from one charset to another.

tag.name: return
tag.description: A new stream that uses the $out_charset. The stream is a subset from the original stream, from its current position to its end.

docblock.description: Sets the default charset(s) for new connections.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The charset to set. If $charsetType is {@link CHARSET_ALL}, you can supply either a string to use for all charsets, or an array with the charset types as keys, and the charsets as values.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Which charset to set. Valid values are the CHARSET_* constants. Any other value is treated as {@link CHARSET_ALL}.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The old charset. If $charsetType is {@link CHARSET_ALL}, the old values will be returned as an array with the types as keys, and charsets as values.

docblock.description: Gets the default charset(s).

tag.name: param
tag.description: Which charset to get. Valid values are the CHARSET_* constants. Any other value is treated as {@link CHARSET_ALL}.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The current charset. If $charsetType is {@link CHARSET_ALL}, the current values will be returned as an array with the types as keys, and charsets as values.

docblock.description: Sets the charset(s) for this connection.
docblock.long-description: Sets the charset(s) for this connection. The specified charset(s) will be used for all future words. When sending, {@link CHARSET_LOCAL} is converted to {@link CHARSET_REMOTE}, and when receiving, {@link CHARSET_REMOTE} is converted to {@link CHARSET_LOCAL}. Setting NULL to either charset will disable charset convertion, and data will be both sent and received "as is".

tag.name: param
tag.description: The charset to set. If $charsetType is {@link CHARSET_ALL}, you can supply either a string to use for all charsets, or an array with the charset types as keys, and the charsets as values.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Which charset to set. Valid values are the Communicator::CHARSET_* constants. Any other value is treated as {@link CHARSET_ALL}.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The old charset. If $charsetType is {@link CHARSET_ALL}, the old values will be returned as an array with the types as keys, and charsets as values.

docblock.description: Gets the charset(s) for this connection.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Which charset to get. Valid values are the CHARSET_* constants. Any other value is treated as {@link CHARSET_ALL}.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The current charset. If $charsetType is {@link CHARSET_ALL}, the current values will be returned as an array with the types as keys, and charsets as values.

docblock.description: Gets the transmitter for this connection.
Sends a word.
docblock.long-description: Sends a word and automatically encodes its length when doing so.

docblock.description: Sends a word based on a stream.
docblock.long-description: Sends a word based on a stream and automatically encodes its length when doing so. The stream is read from its current position to its end, and then returned to its current position. Because of those operations, the supplied stream must be seekable.

tag.name: param
tag.description: A string to prepend before the stream contents.

docblock.description: Verifies that the length is supported.
docblock.long-description: Verifies if the specified length is supported by the API. Throws a {@link LengthException} if that's not the case. Currently, RouterOS supports words up to 0xFFFFFFF in length, so that's the only check performed.

docblock.description: Encodes the length as requred by the RouterOS API.
Get the next word in queue as a string.
docblock.long-description: Get the next word in queue as a string, after automatically decoding its length.

docblock.description: Get the next word in queue as a stream.
docblock.long-description: Get the next word in queue as a stream, after automatically decoding its length.

docblock.description: Decodes the lenght of the incoming message.
docblock.long-description: Decodes the lenght of the incoming message, as specified by the RouterOS API.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The transmitter from which to decode the length of the incoming message.

docblock.description: Closes the opened connection, even if it is a persistent one.

tag.name: return
tag.description: TRUE on success, FALSE on failure.

docblock.description: RouterOS API client implementation.
docblock.long-description:
This package allows you to read and write information from a RouterOS host using MikroTik's RouterOS API.

PHP version 5

docblock.description: Exception thrown when the request/response cycle goes an unexpected way.
RouterOS API client implementation.
docblock.long-description:
This package allows you to read and write information from a RouterOS host using MikroTik's RouterOS API.

PHP version 5

docblock.description: Generic exception class of this package.
RouterOS API client implementation.
docblock.long-description:
This package allows you to read and write information from a RouterOS host using MikroTik's RouterOS API.

PHP version 5

docblock.description: Exception thrown when there's something wrong with message parts.
RouterOS API client implementation.
docblock.long-description:
This package allows you to read and write information from a RouterOS host using MikroTik's RouterOS API.

PHP version 5

docblock.description: Exception thrown when there is a problem with a word's length.
Creates a new LengthException.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The previous exception used for the exception chaining.

docblock.description: Gets the length.
Returns a string representation of the exception.
RouterOS API client implementation.
docblock.long-description:
This package allows you to read and write information from a RouterOS host using MikroTik's RouterOS API.

PHP version 5

docblock.description: Represents a RouterOS message.

tag.name: var
tag.description: An array with message arguments. Keys are the names of the arguments, array values are values for the corresponding argument.

tag.name: var
tag.description: An optional tag to associate the message with.

docblock.description: Sanitizes a name of an argument (message or query one).
Sanitizes a value of an argument (message or query one).
Gets the tag that the message is associated with.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The current tag or NULL if there isn't a tag.

docblock.description: Sets the tag to associate the request with.
docblock.long-description: Sets the tag to associate the message with. Setting NULL erases the currently set tag.

docblock.description: Gets the value of an argument.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The value of the specified argument. Returns NULL if such an argument is not set.

docblock.description: Gets all arguments in an array.

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array with the keys as argument names, and the array values as argument values.

docblock.description: Sets an argument for the message.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Value of the argument. Setting the value to NULL removes an argument of this name.

docblock.description: Removes all arguments from the message.
RouterOS API client implementation.
docblock.long-description:
This package allows you to read and write information from a RouterOS host using MikroTik's RouterOS API.

PHP version 5

docblock.description: Exception thrown when encountering something not supported by RouterOS or this package.
Creates a new NotSupportedException.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The previous exception used for the exception chaining.

docblock.description: Gets the unsupported value.
Returns a string representation of the exception.
RouterOS API client implementation.
docblock.long-description:
This package allows you to read and write information from a RouterOS host using MikroTik's RouterOS API.

PHP version 5

docblock.description: Represents a query for RouterOS requests.
Checks if the property exists.
Checks if the property does not exist.
Checks if the property equals a certain value.
Checks if the property is less than a certain value.
Checks if the property is greather than a certain value.

tag.name: var
tag.description: An array of the words forming the query. Each value is an array with the first member being the predicate (action and name), and the second member being the value for the predicate.

docblock.description: This class is not to be instantiated normally, but by static methods instead. Use {@link where()} to create an instance of it.
Sanitizes the action of a condition.
Creates a new query with an initial condition.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the property to test.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value to test against. Not required for existence tests.

tag.name: param
tag.description: One of the ACTION_* constants. Describes the operation to perform.

docblock.description: Negates the query.
Adds a condition as an alternative to the query.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the property to test.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value to test against. Not required for existence tests.

tag.name: param
tag.description: One of the ACTION_* constants. Describes the operation to perform.

docblock.description: Adds a condition in addition to the query.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the property to test.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value to test against. Not required for existence tests.

tag.name: param
tag.description: One of the ACTION_* constants. Describes the operation to perform.

docblock.description: Sends the query over a communicator.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The communicator to send the query over.

docblock.description: Adds a condition.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the property to test.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value to test against. Not required for existence tests.

tag.name: param
tag.description: One of the ACTION_* constants. Describes the operation to perform.

docblock.description: RouterOS API client implementation.
docblock.long-description:
This package allows you to read and write information from a RouterOS host using MikroTik's RouterOS API.

PHP version 5

docblock.description: Represents a RouterOS request.
Creates a request to send to RouterOS.
Sets the command to send to RouterOS.
docblock.long-description: Sets the command to send to RouterOS. The command can use the API or CLI syntax of RouterOS, but either way, it must be absolute (begin with a "/") and without arguments.

docblock.description: Gets the command that will be send to RouterOS.
docblock.long-description: Gets the command that will be send to RouterOS in its API syntax.

docblock.description: Sets the query to send with the command.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The query to be set. Setting NULL will remove the currently associated query.

docblock.description: Gets the currently associated query
Sets the tag to associate the request with.
docblock.long-description: Sets the tag to associate the request with. Setting NULL erases the currently set tag.

docblock.description: Sets an argument for the request.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Value of the argument. Setting the value to NULL removes an argument of this name.

docblock.description: Removes all arguments from the request.
Sends a request over a communicator.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The communicator to send the request over.

docblock.description: RouterOS API client implementation.
docblock.long-description:
This package allows you to read and write information from a RouterOS host using MikroTik's RouterOS API.

PHP version 5

docblock.description: Represents a RouterOS response.
The last response for a request.
A response with data.
A response signifying error.
A response signifying a fatal error, due to which the connection would be terminated.

tag.name: var
tag.description: An array of unrecognized words in network order.

docblock.description: Extracts a new response from a communicator.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The communicator from which to extract the new response.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Whether to populate the argument values with streams instead of strings.

docblock.description: Sets the response type.
docblock.long-description: Sets the response type. Valid values are the TYPE_* constants.

docblock.description: Gets the response type.
Gets a list of unrecognized words.
RouterOS API client implementation.
docblock.long-description:
This package allows you to read and write information from a RouterOS host using MikroTik's RouterOS API.

PHP version 5

docblock.description: Represents a collection of RouterOS responses.

tag.name: var
tag.description: An array with all {@link Response} objects.

tag.name: var
tag.description: An array with each {@link Response} object's type.

tag.name: var
tag.description: An array with each {@link Response} object's tag.

tag.name: var
tag.description: An array with all distinct arguments across all {@link Response} objects. Created at the first call of {@link getArgumentMap()}.

tag.name: var
tag.description: A pointer, as required by SeekableIterator.

docblock.description: Creates a new collection.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of responses, in network order.

docblock.description: Gets the whole collection as an array.

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array with all responses, in network order.

docblock.description: Counts the responses in the collection.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The number of responses in the collection.

docblock.description: Checks if an offset exists.

tag.name: return
tag.description: TRUE if the offset exists, FALSE otherwise.

docblock.description: Gets a {@link Response} from a specified offset.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The offset of the desired response.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The response at the specified offset.

docblock.description: N/A
docblock.long-description: This method exists only because it is required for ArrayAccess. The collection is read only.

docblock.description: N/A
docblock.long-description: This method exists only because it is required for ArrayAccess. The collection is read only.

docblock.description: Resets the pointer to 0, and returns the first response.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The first response in the collection, or FALSE if the collection is empty.

docblock.description: Moves the position pointer to a specified position.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The {@link Response} at the specified position, or FALSE if the specified position is not valid.

docblock.description: Moves the pointer forward by 1, and gets the next response.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The next {@link Response} object, or FALSE if the position is not valid.

docblock.description: Gets the response at the current pointer position.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The response at the current pointer position, or FALSE if the position is not valid.

docblock.description: Gets the key at the current pointer position.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The key at the current pointer position, i.e. the pointer position itself, or FALSE if the position is not valid.

docblock.description: Checks if the pointer is still pointing to an existing offset.

tag.name: return
tag.description: TRUE if the pointer is valid, FALSE otherwise.

docblock.description: Gets all distinct argument names.
docblock.long-description: Gets all distinct argument names across all responses.

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array with all distinct argument names as keys, and the indexes at which they occur as values.

docblock.description: Gets all responses of a specified type.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The response type to filter by. Valid values are the Response::TYPE_* constants.

tag.name: return
tag.description: A new collection with responses of the specified type.

docblock.description: Gets all responses with a specified tag.

tag.name: return
tag.description: A new collection with responses having the specified tag.

docblock.description: Gets the last {@link Response} in the collection.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The last response in the collection.

docblock.description: Calls a method of the response pointed by the pointer.
docblock.long-description: Calls a method of the response pointed by the pointer. This is a magic PHP method, thanks to which any function you call on the collection that is not defined will be redirected to the response.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the method to call.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The arguments to pass to the method.

docblock.description: RouterOS API client implementation.
docblock.long-description:
This package allows you to read and write information from a RouterOS host using MikroTik's RouterOS API.

PHP version 5

docblock.description: Exception thrown when something goes wrong with the connection.
RouterOS API client implementation.
docblock.long-description:
This package allows you to read and write information from a RouterOS host using MikroTik's RouterOS API.

PHP version 5

docblock.description: Exception thrown when encountering something not supported by RouterOS or this package.
Creates a new UnexpectedValueException.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The previous exception used for the exception chaining.

docblock.description: Gets the unexpected value.
Returns a string representation of the exception.
